alert.note: Alert for Bertie; Gates; Hertford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 5:19PM EDT until August 04 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Bertie County in northeastern North Carolina... West Central Gates County in northeastern North Carolina... Northwestern Hertford County in northeastern North Carolina... * Until 830 PM EDT. * At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ahoskie, Aulander, Winton, Cofield, Powellsville, Union, Brantleys Grove, Proctors Corner, Poor Town, Earleys, Oak Villa, Saint John, Tunis, Millennium, Connaritsa and Rays Beach. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
